description:
The use as television studios  including offices
technical and production areas  workshops and storage
with works of rebuilding  extension  conversion and
alterations to the external elevations at 192/212 Grays
Inn Road and 10-22 Coley Street and the use and
alteration of part of the ground and the basement level
at 214 Grays Inn Road for parking purposes
as illustrated in drawing numbers 6073-5-TP/100A-104A
105-110  111A  112  113A  114  115A & 116  revised by
letter dated 24th August 1987.
Appeal received against conditions of permission
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the elevations and facing materials to be
    used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall
    have been submitted to and approved by the Council before
    any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 2 - That car parking provision at basement level of 214 Grays
    Inn Road shall not exceed 84 car parking spaces, and shall
    be retained permanently for the parking of vehicles of the
    occupiers and users of the building at 192-212 Grays Inn
    Road and 10-22 Coley Street.

Condition : 3 - No loading or unloading of goods,including fuel, by
    vehicles arriving at or departing from the premises shall
    be carried out otherwise than within the curtilage of the
    building.

Condition : 4 - Details of access, with regards to contractors vehicles and
    vans, during building operations, should be submitted to
    the Council before works commence.

Condition : 5 - Details of the plant shall not be otherwise than as shall
    have been approved by the Council before any work on the
    site is commenced.

Condition : 6 - The proposed satellite dishes shall not be installed
    without the prior approval of the Council.

Condition : 7 - No process shall be carried on or machinery installed which
    is not such as could be carried on or installed in any
    residential area without detriment to the amenity of that
    area by reason of noise, vibration, smell, fumes, smoke,
    soot, ash, dust or grit.

Condition : 8 - The development hereby approved at 192/212 Grays Inn Road
    and 10/22 Coley Street and at 214 Grays Inn Road (part
    ground floor and basements) shall be personal to
    Independent Television News Ltd (ITN) and shall only be
    used for the purposes of television studios and purposes
    ancillary to television production and for no other purpose
    (including any other purpose within Class B1 of the
    Schedule of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes)
    Order 1987).

Condition : 9 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 10 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the building
    does not add to traffic congestion.

Condition : 11 - To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard amenities of adjacent premises.

Condition : 12 - In order that the Council may give consideration to this
    matter and minimise noise disturbance and other nuisance in
    the immediate area.

Condition : 13 - & 06. In order that the Council may give further
    consideration to  this matter.

Condition : 14 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and
    the area generally.

Condition : 15 - To ensure that the Council's office policy, as expressed in
    the Borough Plan, is not prejudiced.

Condition : 16 - Your attention is drawn to the requirements of Sections 4,
    7, and 8A of the Chronically Sick & Disabled Persons Act
    1970 that this development (for employment use or to which
    the public will be admitted) should be made accessible to
    disabled people wherever practicable. Guidance is provided
    in British Standards Institution Code of Practice BS 5588
    1987 "Access for the Disabled to Buildings".

Condition : 17 - Noise from demolition and construction works is subject to
    control under The Control of Pollution Act 1974. You are
    advised to consult the Council's Planning, Transport &
    Health Service, Pollution Team, Town Hall, Argyle Street
    entrance, Euston Road, WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 071-278 4444), or to
    seek prior approval under Section 61 if you anticipate any
    difficulty in carrying out construction other than within
    normal working hours and by means that would minimise
    disturbance to adjoining premises.

Condition : 18 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not
    and that this working  party will continue when ITN are in
    occupation. 05The applicants are requested to contact The
    Divisional Manager, ThamesWater Authority, Central Division,
    New River Head, Rosbery Avenue,London EC1, (Tel:
    01-833-6630) regarding works affecting the publicsewerage
    system.
    take place other than between the hours of 8am to 6pm on
    Monday to Friday and 8am to 1pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards. 04The Council welcomes the
    proposal of setting up a working party  between ITN, EPR,
    representatives from local Tenants Associations,
    representatives from contractors carring out works to the
